thread.title: Influential Arsenal Supporters’ Trust tells Arsene Wenger he simply must call it a day
thread.title_full: Influential Arsenal Supporters’ Trust tells Arsene Wenger he simply must call it a day

author: gsweet
title: Influential Arsenal Supporters’ Trust tells Arsene Wenger he simply must call it a day
text:
Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments THE pressure on Arsene Wenger to quit has increased with Arsenal’s leading fans’ group calling for him to step down. 
A survey conducted by the influential Arsenal Supporters’ Trust of their 1,000 members revealed that a massive 78 per cent feel the Frenchman should call it a day. Getty Images 5 Does he go or does he stay? Arsene Wenger is staying tight-lipped 
That figure contrasts with the last survey on Wenger’s future conducted 18 months ago that saw 84 per cent backing him to continue. 
Keep up to date with all the latest news, gossip, rumours and done deals in SunSport’s live transfer blog 
Wenger has a two – year deal sitting on the table but has yet to sign. 
He hinted on Friday that he will be staying by confirming he is looking ahead to new signings for next season. 
But the result of the AST poll is bad news for the man who has led the North London club for 21 years. EPA Disgruntled fans have shown their displeasure throughout the season PA:Press Association 5 There have been protests inside and outside the Emirates 
Wenger has been the subject of various fans’ group protests over the past few weeks and another march will take place before Sunday’s home date with Manchester City. Most popular SHEFF SERVED UP HOT CURRIE Tony Currie looked like a glam rocker and when on song was one of the 70s' top players deal me in Arsenal, Chelsea, Manchester United and ALL Premier League clubs - get the latest transfer news, updates and gossip Ben banned Burton Albion midfielder Ben Turner handed five-match ban by the FA for racially abusing an opponent Blues' Ed-ache Chelsea will NOT sell Eden Hazard to Real Madrid as they look to secure Antonio Conte's long-term future Poch to Chop for Wilf Spurs to move for Wilf Zaha this summer with Erik Lamela and Moussa Sissoko facing axe Gong with the wind Romelu Lukaku wins Prem player of the month for March as Andros Townsend bags award for best goal PAT ON THE BACK Patrick Vieira tipped for Arsenal return to work with Arsene Wenger if boss signs new Gunners deal TV Times What TV channel is showing Arsenal vs Manchester City, what time is it on and what is the team news? 
Never before has the AST ballotted their members during the season. But feelings are running so high amid following four defeats in five games games that have dropped the Gunners to sixth place in the Premier League. 
There are now real fears that Arsenal will fail to qualify for the Champions League for the first time under Wenger. 
This feeling is reflected in the AST vote. And Trust spokesman Tim Payton told the Evening Standard: “The bond between the club’s longest-serving manager and the fans has until recently remained strong. Rex Features Now the respected Arsenal Supporters’ Trust has called for Wenger to step down Rex Features 5 Wenger has stood firm but is yet to reveal his hand 
“Sure, many grew frustrated with aspects of his management and called for change but only now do a majority believe it is time for him to go. 
“I would love Wenger to pre-empt this issue and announce his departure before the season ends. That way fans can use the final games of his remarkable career to give him the rousing send-off he deserves but is in danger of missing out on.” Arsene Wenger refuses to confirm about his decision to stay as manager at Arsenal 
A total of 550 members took part in the AST poll and, of the 450 who submitted written views, less than three per cent actually want Wenger fired. 
But the fans cited 11 per cent cited the need for fresh ideas, a lack of leadership and a perceived lack of ambition as the main reasons for their unrest.
